item.title: Quarkus Observability Roadmap 2023
item.description: Quarkus has come a long way in the observability space. Initial support for Tracing and Metrics came from MicroProfile and their respective implementations, SmallRye OpenTracing and SmallRye Metrics. Because the observability space evolved, these implementations expanded beyond the original specifications, and the Quarkus extensions providing Tracing and Metrics have been...
item.author: Roberto Cortez (https://twitter.com/radcortez)

item.title: Quarkus 2.13.4.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: Today, we released Quarkus 2.13.4.Final with a new round of bugfixes and documentation improvements. It is a recommended upgrade for anyone already using 2.13. If you are not already using 2.13, please refer to our migration guide. GraalVM/Mandrel upgrade We don’t usually upgrade GraalVM/Mandrel in a micro release but GraalVM/Mandrel...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus 2.13.3.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: Today, we released Quarkus 2.13.3.Final with a new round of bugfixes and documentation improvements. It is a recommended and safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.13. Especially since it fixes a Jackson CVE (even if you probably are not affected by the CVE, better be safe). If you are not...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus 2.13.2.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: 2.13.2.Final is the second maintenance release of the 2.13 release train. As usual, it contains bugfixes and documentation improvements. item.title: Quarkus Newsletter #25 - October
item.description: It’s that time of the month…​ time for the latest Quarkus newsletter! "Tutorial: Build a Quarkus web app with Azure App Service on Linux and PostgreSQL" walks you through the process of building, configuring, deploying, and scaling Java web apps on Azure. item.title: Quarkus 2.13.1.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: 2.13.1.Final is the first maintenance release of the 2.13 release train. It comes with a bunch of bugfixes and documentation improvements. item.title: Quarkus 2.13.0.Final released - Cross site request forgery prevention filter, Kafka Dev UI
item.description: We don’t have a ton of big new features in Quarkus 2.13.0.Final but it comes with a ton of small enhancements that should improve your overall experience with Quarkus. It still comes with some exciting stuff: Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) prevention filter for RESTEasy Reactive (well, security is not...

item.title: Quarkus Tools for IntelliJ 1.13.0 released!
item.description: We are very pleased to announce the 1.13.0 release of Quarkus Tools for IntelliJ. This release improves the Qute developer experience. Improved Qute developer experience InlayHint support InlayHint is a new feature. It allows to add inline information about parameters and variables. This is very useful for Qute templates to...
item.author: Jeff Maury (https://twitter.com/jeffmaury)

item.title: How to implement a job queue with Redis
item.description: In how to cache with Redis, we implemented a simple cache backed by Redis. That’s just one use case of Redis. Redis is also used as a messaging server to implement the processing of background jobs or other kinds of messaging tasks. This post explores implementing this pattern with Quarkus...
item.author: Clement Escoffier (https://twitter.com/clementplop)
